config.question: Why did President Polk change tactics and appoint a new commander, General Winfield Scott, to win the Mexican–American War?

choices.content: The previous commander, Taylor, had been captured by the Mexican army.
The Mexican army had switched from traditional to guerilla military tactics.
The Mexican army had drafted a number of British mercenaries.
The previous commander, Taylor, was lenient toward the Mexican soldiers.

answer_3.response: Consider This: General Scott was ordered to prepare an attack that would place the American army within striking distance of Mexico City. Taylor was left to hold his position in northern Mexico. See L.O. 13.1 Why did the United States annex Texas and the Southwest?
